newsitem.title: POLAND: BIG shareholders approve new issue.
newsitem.headline: BIG shareholders approve new issue.

text.p: Shareholders of Polish Bank Inicjatyw Gospodarczych SA (BIG) approved the bank's new issue of up to 75 million shares ex rights, a BIG official said on Monday.
He said during the bank's shareholders meeting current BIG shareholders would get one share of the between 60 and 75-million share issue, for each five currently held, but gave no other details.

Part of the issue would also be offered in a public subscription to domestic investors and foreign banks which agree to act as depositary banks for ia possible issue of American Depositary Receipts (ADRs) or Global Depositary Receipts (GDRs).
BIG president Boguslaw Kott said funds from the issue would be used to finance investments in its subsidiary Bank Gdanski.
BIG, which now has 163.47 million shares outstanding, earlier said the new share issue would rank among the biggest in the Polish market's history.
It also said that by offering the new shares ex-rights it could price them through book-building.
Last month BIG has doubled its stake in Bank Gdanski to about 63 percent paying the state treasury about 250 million zlotys.
